metadata.title: CVE-2019-19524 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.3.12, there is a use-after-free bug that canbe caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/input/ff-memless.cdriver, aka CID-fa3a5a1880c9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-171-generic - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-lowlatency - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-4.4.0-171-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-171-generic - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-171-lowlatency - 4.4.0-171.200
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-74-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-74-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-74-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-74-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-74-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1064-kvm - 4.4.0-1064.71
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1100-aws - 4.4.0-1100.111
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1057-aws - 4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1066-azure - 4.15.0-1066.71
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1052-gcp - 4.15.0-1052.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1031-oracle - 4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1127-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1127.136
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1131-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1131.139
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-171.200').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1064.71').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.111').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.56').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.136').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.139').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
